data.text: A usually green, flattened, lateral structure attached to a stem and functioning as a principal organ of photosynthesis and transpiration in most plants.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: Leaves considered as a group; foliage.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: The state or time of having or showing leaves.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: The leaves of a plant used or processed for a specific purpose.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: Any of the sheets of paper bound in a book, each side of which constitutes a page.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A very thin sheet of material, especially metal.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: Such leaves considered as a group.
